[quote=“12igon8, post:30, topic:389690”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=485601.msg3571711#msg3571711 date=1303091027]
To create a piss poor way for “blocking” flooders? Your method is asinine, and useless. Your proposed solution is not a solution at all. In fact, it’s ultimately making any server that implements this, even more unstable. Just listen to people who know what they’re talking about. You might learn something instead of assuming that because your method “works” it’s the best method.
[/quote]

Your still not understanding the point of this thread…

-sigh-[/quote]

you’re

Also, when you understand anything, come back. As for now, gtfo.

item.title: [562 REV] Good way to weaken Flooders/Spammers with very little code
item.dc:creator: @12igon8 12igon8
item.description:
@12igon8 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:27, topic:389690”][quote author=12igon8 link=topic=485601.msg3570937#msg3570937 date=1303054202]

I don’t need to make one. Anything that can be done by a human, can be automated. If you add this “::verifycode” command or whatever, I’m assuming that the server sends a message to the client, saying something like “type ::verifycode #### to prove you’re not a bot”. A bot could easily read the “sendMessage” packet that was sent, substring it, send a chat packet to the server with the code. Done.

Pseudo-code:

if (packetId_ == sendMessageId) {
    String msg = stream.getString();
    if (msg.contains("verifycode")) {
        String code = msg.substring(x, y);
        Packet p = new ChatPacket("::verifycode " + Integer.parseInt(code));
        sendPacket(p);
    }
}

etc.

I’m not negative about everything. I quite enjoy sex, stuffed crust pizza, and Mtn Dew. But what you’re suggesting is nothing more than a bandage, ultimately covering the security flaws most servers have.

why not just make it so they cant even talk in that area so they cant flood period unless they teleport?

Why not just make it so that they can’t even log in at all, to prevent the filling of player slots and the waste of memory use?

Exactly, that’s what they should do.

Do it for 562 and then get back to me.

Until you go learn something, get off my thread.
[/quote]

When you learn basic security policies, and understand something more than piece of shit RSPS “coding”, get back to me.[/quote]

lmfao kid you still don’t understand the purpose of this thread…

Read full topic

why not just make it so they cant even talk in that area so they cant flood period unless they teleport?

Why not just make it so that they can’t even log in at all, to prevent the filling of player slots and the waste of memory use?

Exactly, that’s what they should do.
[/quote]

Until you go learn something, get off my thread.[/quote]

When you learn basic security policies, and understand something more than piece of shit RSPS “coding”, get back to me.

item.title: [562 REV] Good way to weaken Flooders/Spammers with very little code
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“12igon8, post:22, topic:389690”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=485601.msg3567430#msg3567430 date=1302754529]

Why don’t you just add in a code for the player is muted until they do a emote :rolleyes:

EDIT: But this is a way too prevent flooders from spamming, until newer players happen too join while the person is at the Default Location causing lag.

all of the public flooders for 562s only send 10 players, not causing that much lag.

Still, I’ve seen people host their server on 2GB Vista laptops, which would kinda be laggy from all those accounts being made at once ;/. I look at the downside :rolleyes: , but your right tbh, no-one else I know host’s on 2gb vista latpops but, the emote wouldn’t be hard too do, it’d be like ::verifycode on some 508’s :rolleyes:

Bots could easily get around this.
[/quote]

Until you make one that can, quit being negative about everything.[/quote]

I don’t need to make one. Anything that can be done by a human, can be automated. If you add this “::verifycode” command or whatever, I’m assuming that the server sends a message to the client, saying something like “type ::verifycode #### to prove you’re not a bot”. A bot could easily read the “sendMessage” packet that was sent, substring it, send a chat packet to the server with the code. Done.

Pseudo-code:

if (packetId_ == sendMessageId) {
    String msg = stream.getString();
    if (msg.contains("verifycode")) {
        String code = msg.substring(x, y);
        Packet p = new ChatPacket("::verifycode " + Integer.parseInt(code));
        sendPacket(p);
    }
}

etc.

I’m not negative about everything. I quite enjoy sex, stuffed crust pizza, and Mtn Dew. But what you’re suggesting is nothing more than a bandage, ultimately covering the security flaws most servers have.

Read full topic

item.title: [562 REV] Good way to weaken Flooders/Spammers with very little code
item.dc:creator: @12igon8 12igon8
item.description:
@12igon8 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:15, topic:389690”][quote author=12igon8 link=topic=485601.msg3563957#msg3563957 date=1302484488]
It doesnt create more problems? And the reason is because there are currently an army of noobs that leech servers, make money off them, and pay good programmers to make their servers better
[/quote]

It does. If you don’t allow them to connect, it is much more efficient than allowing them to connect, taking up space in a player slot, and moving them to a DEFAULT_LOCATION.

You, nor anyone else can stop people from giving money to people who run servers. The system isn’t perfect. But what you’re doing is MAKING people pay for your code.[/quote]

Now your getting way off topic.

I’m not selling anything. This is just very simple and makes your server look a ‘little’ bit better than just some stupid leech.

Read full topic

It does. If you don’t allow them to connect, it is much more efficient than allowing them to connect, taking up space in a player slot, and moving them to a DEFAULT_LOCATION.

You, nor anyone else can stop people from giving money to people who run servers. The system isn’t perfect. But what you’re doing is MAKING people pay for your code.
